problem:
Find the value of the following expression:

$$\left| \, |{ -|{-1 + 1}| - 1 }| + 1\right|.$$
model_solution:
Step 1: Evaluate the expression inside the innermost absolute value: $-1 + 1 = 0$
Step 2: Evaluate the expression inside the absolute value sign: $|-0 - 1| = |-1| = 1$
Step 3: Evaluate the expression inside the outermost absolute value: $\left| 1 + 1\right| = \left| 2\right| = 2$
Step 4: Evaluate the expression inside the outermost absolute value: $\left| 2\right| = 2$
Step 5: $\left| 2\right| = 2$
Step 6: $\left| 2\right| = 2$
Step 7: $\left| 2\right| = 2$
Step 8: $\left|\,2\right| = 2$
Step 9: 2
Step 10: 2
steps: Step 1: Evaluate the expression inside the innermost absolute value: $-1 + 1 = 0$
Step 2: Evaluate the expression inside the absolute value sign: $|-0 - 1| = |-1| = 1$
Step 3: Evaluate the expression inside the outermost absolute value: $\left| 1 + 1\right| = \left| 2\right| = 2$
Step 4: Evaluate the expression inside the outermost absolute value: $\left| 2\right| = 2$
full_steps: Step 1: Evaluate the expression inside the innermost absolute value: $-1 + 1 = 0$
Step 2: Evaluate the expression inside the absolute value sign: $|-0 - 1| = |-1| = 1$
Step 3: Evaluate the expression inside the outermost absolute value: $\left| 1 + 1\right| = \left| 2\right| = 2$
Step 4: Evaluate the expression inside the outermost absolute value: $\left| 2\right| = 2$
